title: Will a renewable energy bill be approved by the Massachusetts Legislature by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a renewable energy bill is approved by the Massachusetts Legislature. Approval must be documented by an official vote or announcement from the Massachusetts Legislature.

title: Will Intel reinstate suspended projects by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Intel has officially announced the reinstatement of any previously suspended projects. The reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements from Intel or widely reported by reputable news organizations such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post.

body: This question will resolve as YES if Rebeca Andrade wins an Olympic all-around gymnastics title by August 31, 2024. The win must be confirmed by official Olympic results and reported by reputable news organizations.

title: Will India and Vietnam double their trade and investment by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that India and Vietnam have doubled their trade and investment compared to the baseline set at the time of the announcement. The confirmation must come from an official government report or be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a journalist be released from Russian imprisonment as part of a prisoner swap by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a journalist is released from Russian imprisonment as part of a confirmed prisoner swap. The release must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). This question resolves as NO if no such release is confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will the average number of weekly jobless claims in the U.S. exceed 240,000 by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average number of weekly jobless claims in the U.S. exceeds 240,000 according to data published by the U.S. Department of Labor. The average will be calculated based on the weekly jobless claims reported from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024. If the average does not exceed 240,000 by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a rule banning airlines from charging parents to sit with their children be implemented by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a rule is implemented by the U.S. Department of Transportation that bans airlines from charging parents extra to sit with their children aged 13 or younger. The rule must be officially enacted and in effect by this date. If the rule is not implemented by this date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the US road safety agency conclude its investigation into the April crash near Seattle involving a Tesla by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if the US road safety agency concludes its investigation into the April crash near Seattle involving a Tesla operating on the company's 'Full Self-Driving' system by August 31, 2024. A conclusion is defined as the agency releasing an official report or statement regarding the investigation. If no such conclusion is made public by the end of August 2024, this question resolves as NO.
